chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Sabrina M. Cross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sabrina M. Cross is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sabrina M. Cross was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

records.addlTxt:
8:39 AM Defendant Sabrina M. Cross appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Sabrina M. Cross. Assistant D.A. Mary M Sowinski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Magallones statement-defendant waives preliminary hearing; defendant confirms. Court finds waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Sowinski notes Information will mirror the complaint. Magallones wishes to proceed to arraignment/enters not guilty pleas. Magallones speaks to bond modification/State stipulates to signature bond. Court will amend bond to $5,000 signature bond. adj. 8:45 a.m.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sabrina M. Cross appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Sabrina M. Cross. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing. Defendant statement to bond. Court takes request under advisement and continues bond. 02:02 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Sabrina M. Cross appeared by video, in custody. Court review of case. Defendant states contacted PD's office and they still need to appoint. Court will set out. Pfeifer/Defendant statement to bond. Court adjust bond. 01:35 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Sabrina M. Cross appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Defendant statement to bail. Court set $1000 bond over weekend. Court continues bond. adj. 01:40 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
